title: Grilled Shrimp With Citrus-sambal-oelek Dressing
summary: Grilled Shrimp With Citrus-sambal-oelek Dressing might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 700 calories, 93g of protein, and 33g of fat each. For $9.54 per serving, this recipe covers 36% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Head to the store and pick up jumbo shrimp, oregano, lime juice, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 76%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Grilled Shrimp with Citrus-Sambal-Oelek Dressing, Sambal Oelek Seitan Wings, and Javanese Sambal with Grilled Shrimp.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Anne Amie Pinot Gris. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.
